Formula 1 – 2026 Season Knowledge Base Overview Formula 1 is the highest class of single-seater auto racing sanctioned by the FIA. The 2026 season features 23 races across multiple countries, with teams and drivers competing for the Drivers’ and Constructors’ Championships. The season includes both historical context and up-to-date regulations. Official Rules and Regulations Safety Car Regulations When the safety car is deployed during a race, all drivers must reduce their speed to match the safety car. Overtaking is strictly prohibited until the safety car exits the track. Drivers must maintain formation and follow the safety car procedures as described in Article 40.3 of the FIA regulations. Qualifying Format Qualifying consists of three segments: Q1, Q2, and Q3. Drivers are eliminated after Q1 and Q2 based on their lap times. The fastest driver in Q3 earns the pole position for the race.
